dt: {bc}to keep, hold, or maintain in the mind

dt.t: I {wi}entertain{/wi} grave doubts about her sincerity.

dt: {bc}to play against (an opposing team) on one's home field or court

pt: {sc}amuse{/sc} {sc}divert{/sc} {sc}entertain{/sc} mean to pass or cause to pass the time pleasantly. {sc}amuse{/sc} suggests that one's attention is engaged lightly.
{sc}divert{/sc} implies distracting attention from worry or routine occupation especially by something funny.

pt.t: a light comedy to {it}divert{/it} the tired businessman

pt: {sc}entertain{/sc} suggests supplying amusement by specially contrived methods.

pt.t: a magician {it}entertaining{/it} children at a party

et: Middle English {it}entertinen{/it}, from Middle French {it}entretenir{/it}, from {it}entre-{/it} inter- + {it}tenir{/it} to hold {ma}{mat|tenable|}{/ma}
shortdef: to keep, hold, or maintain in the mind
